lexUnit.name: locate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: discover the exact place or position of.

sentence.text: Under Artois , we located a divorce fixing agency and a company which supplied water -- but no sign of Rene .
It only took her moments to locate the spy-fly roosting in a shadow , to aim her digital laser and evaporate the tiny surveillance device .
He groped his way through the shadows at the foot of the stairs , located the large brass handle and turned it with both hands .
A physician scanning the video image of the patient 's biomagnetic field , quickly locates an energy field disturbance -- a typical precursor of cancer .
Bodie came on the radio , confirming that Mayli Koulo had located Lin Foh 's whereabouts .
The dogs locate the bait easily by smell , but the native Galapagos animals , which seek food primarily by sight , do not manage to find it .
In addition , it can locate prey by smell alone , scenting blood from well over half a kilometre away .
It locates its food by vibrations and is attracted to anything which generates the right sort of disturbance .
One such indication is the readiness with which some philosophers talk of a person locating a pain in another person 's body , or in an article of furniture .
Webber 's job was to locate any pitfalls in the concept which might give substance to Wilson 's original ` maybe " about the show .
He quickly located his man in the deep doorway where he had positioned himself , by the intermittent glow of his cigarette .
The archive was thus virtually unusable since it was impossible to locate all the material on any given topic .
Bees navigate using the sun , and for millions of years they have used polarised light to locate their guide on cloudy days .
He was just over three hours late to meet his guide , locating him at last on the edge of a ruck of Army drivers , forlorn in Air Force blue .
They flew out fast , located the target with the aid of their radar equipment , dropped their coloured indicators to show the heavy boys where to go , and then nipped smartly back to base .
One must try to locate the precise questions with which to replace Marx 's schematism .
Bury a 5p , 10p , 50p and one pound coin an inch or two below ground , and then locate them with your machine .

Trumpet fish may even locate their prey by listening out for fish 's calls .
The contemporary visitor can locate the approximate link-up by studying the directions of the numerous shot-holes .

One important Communist still eluding capture was Jose Weibel , Secretary General of the Young Communists , and the Joint Command decided to try and locate him through his brother Ricardo , a bus driver .
She had tried to locate him for over two years , in both America and Canada , where John had been living and working for a number of years .
The restaurant where she had arranged to meet Piers was close to the Palais Lascaris , an old , breathtakingly beautiful town house , and she located it without too much difficulty .
I stumbled around a while then finally located the car .
From approximately 10 months the baby progressively overcomes this error and will successfully locate the target .

Since the relevant ones will be concentrated in one area of the inverted tree they can be quickly located by moving from the root downwards and along the correct branches , without ever having to search the whole database .
Police have located the owner of a van with the same number plates , who described the builders ' logo on the vehicle when he sold it several months ago .

When the Titanic was finally located on t he sea-bed a crew went down in a tiny submarine to explore the wreckage .
We were convinced that we had located , by accident , the last resting place of HMS Impregnable .
It was suggested she 'd gone to live at Newport in Gwent , but she was never located .
A badger will stand its ground , so if you locate where it is you can dig it up and need only one net . ”
